EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network at positions (0.0, 0.0), (5.0, 0.0), (2.5, 0.5) & (2.5, -0.5)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace for Iron Smelting at (0.0, 0.0)
 – Stone Furnace at (0.0, 0.0) paired with a Burner Inserter at (1.5, 0.5).
• Stone Furnace for Copper Smelting at (5.0, 0.0)
 – Stone Furnace at (5.0, 0.0) with an associated Burner Inserter at (3.5, 0.5).
• Common Input Chest:
 – Wooden Chest at (2.5, 0.5) stocking copper-plate.
• New Feeder Inserter:
 – Feeder Inserter at (2.5, -0.5) with pickup at (2.5, -1.5) and drop at (2.5, 0.5).
• Transport Belt Connection:
 – BeltGroup linking mining output at (-14.5, -47.5) to the feeder inserter pickup at (2.5, -1.5) using 64 belts.

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup at position (-15.0, -50.0)
Consists of:
• Burner Mining Drill:
 – Burner Mining Drill at (-15.0, -50.0) with output drop at (-14.5, -48.5).
• Drill Inserter:
 – Drill Inserter at (-13.5, -47.5) transferring ore from the mining drill.
• Output Sink & Extraction System:
 – Wooden Chest (sink chest) at (-14.5, -51.5) intended to receive ore.
• Supplemental Burner Inserter:
 – Burner Inserter at (-14.5, -52.5) with pickup at (-14.5, -53.5) and drop at (-14.5, -51.5) to feed ore into the sink chest.
• Belt Connection Attempts:
 – Multiple efforts to place transport and underground belt segments between the mining drill drop (at -14.5, -48.5) and the burner inserter pickup (at -14.5, -53.5) failed due to grid alignment and buildability conflicts.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Belt Connection and Placement:
 – Ensure candidate belt positions are grid-aligned and fall within buildable areas.
 – Validate computed paths (using techniques like floor rounding) and use intermediary inserters as needed.
• Entity Placement Validation:
 – Verify the target tile is free, appropriately unoccupied, and within the allowed building range before placing objects such as burner inserters or wooden chests.
 – Use precise and consistent prototype identifiers to avoid placement conflicts.
• Undefined Function Usage:
 – Avoid using undefined function names. An error showed that “shift_entity” is not defined; use the correctly defined shift_entity_local instead.
• Sink Chest Repositioning:
 – Confirm that repositioning targets for sink chests are within the player’s range and that the designated area is buildable.
• Inventory and Connection Checks:
 – Ensure all intermediary components (like inserter placements) are properly configured prior to establishing belt connections to prevent output blockages.

NAMESPACE
─────────
• shift_entity_local(entity: Entity, offset: Tuple[float, float]) -> Entity  
 – Shifts the given entity’s position by the specified offset.
  – Invocation Note: Previously used during sink chest repositioning; failures occurred when the entity’s prototype did not match expectations.

Important Variables:
• furnace_input_chest_pos (Position) – Holds the position of the furnace input chest.
• current_player_inventory (Inventory) – Tracks the current state of the player’s inventory.
